events.name: Child Drawing Analysis and Drawing Techniques
events.description:
The Child Drawing Analysis and Drawing Techniques Practitioner Certificate Program will be conducted by Cln. Psk. Pınar Gümüş Sarı on 6-7 July.

Program Introduction
It aims to explain the use of children's drawings from a psycho-pedagogical perspective to understand the child and guide the work carried out with the child. It conveys to the participants what the important indicators in the drawing mean for the experts and the points to consider in the interpretation of the drawing.

events.name: Brief Solution-Focused Therapy
events.description:
The brief solution-focused approach consists of a set of special techniques that therapists and counselors use during the counseling process. These techniques help the client focus on their strengths and moments when the problem is not experienced and are supported by various tasks and exercises. The approach is based on the perspective that 'Problems are experienced, solutions are found' and takes momentum from the client to achieve change. The client is encouraged to try ways they have never tried before in solving the problem, remember periods when the problem was manageable, and positive aspects are revealed to achieve change and contribute to sustaining this change. The focus is on the 'Here and Now,' not the past and future.

* Only psychology and psychological counseling and guidance students and graduates can participate in our programs.

* Supervision is planned as a single day outside of the program days. A 3-hour supervision session will be held with the participants 2 weeks after the training.

events.name: MMPI Certification Program
events.description:
Content Topics

1. The theoretical and conceptual content of the Minnesota Multiphasic Personality Inventory (MMPI);
▫️ The purpose and process of developing the MMPI; its psychometric properties

▫️ Emphasis on the advantages and limitations of the MMPI

Explanation of the standardization study in Turkey

▫️ Explanation of why MMPI 2 was needed

2. Administration of the MMPI
▫️ Points to consider when administering the test (who it will be administered to, the physical conditions in which it will be administered, who it cannot be administered to)

▫️ Points to consider during the test interview and test process

▫️ How observations will be interpreted

3. Minnesota Multiphasic Personality Inventory (MMPI):
▫️ Introduction of validity and clinical subscales

▫️ Identification of dual elevation types

▫️ Identification and interpretation of configurations

▫️ Examination of psychotic and neurotic profiles

▫️ Examples of invalid profiles

4. Interpretation of the MMPI
▫️ How the MMPI profile will be derived and what to consider

▫️ Computer calculation, how to use the computer program

▫️ Practical profile creation on a sample answer sheet

▫️ Handling validity subscales individually and as a whole on sample profiles

▫️ Interpretation of rising and falling scales in clinical subscales

▫️ Determination of the client's level of adaptation

Interpretation of dual and triple elevations

▫️ Addressing specific patterns in validity and clinical subscales

▫️ Interpretation of the profile as a whole by addressing findings in validity and clinical subscales together

5. Reporting the Profile
▫️ Points to consider when reporting

▫️ Integration of clinical observation with the MMPI profile

▫️ Converting findings identified in the profile into a written report

▫️ Working on and providing sample reports
